access_key.description: API Key used to authenticate with the rancher server

api_url.description: The URL to the rancher API

ca_certs.description: CA certificates used to sign rancher server tls certificates. Mandatory if self signed tls and insecure option false

insecure.description: Allow insecure connections to Rancher. Mandatory if self signed tls and not ca_certs provided

secret_key.description: API secret used to authenticate with the rancher server

token_key.description: API token used to authenticate with the rancher server

values_yaml.description: values.yaml base64 encoded file content of the app

wait.description: Wait until app is deployed and active

default_pod_security_policy_template_id.description: Default pod security policy template id

aad_server_app_secret.description: The secret of an Azure Active Directory server application

aad_tenant_id.description: The ID of an Azure Active Directory tenant

add_client_app_id.description: The ID of an Azure Active Directory client application of type "Native". This application is for user login via kubectl

add_server_app_id.description: The ID of an Azure Active Directory server application of type "Web app/API". This application represents the managed cluster's apiserver (Server application)

admin_username.description: The administrator username to use for Linux hosts

agent_dns_prefix.description: DNS prefix to be used to create the FQDN for the agent pool

agent_os_disk_size.description: GB size to be used to specify the disk for every machine in the agent pool. If you specify 0, it will apply the default according to the "agent vm size" specified

agent_pool_name.description: Name for the agent pool, upto 12 alphanumeric characters

agent_storage_profile.description: Storage profile specifies what kind of storage used on machine in the agent pool. Chooses from [ManagedDisks StorageAccount]

agent_vm_size.description: Size of machine in the agent pool

auth_base_url.description: Different authentication API url to use

base_url.description: Different resource management API url to use

client_secret.description: Azure client secret associated with the "client id"

count.description: Number of machines (VMs) in the agent pool. Allowed values must be in the range of 1 to 100 (inclusive)

dns_service_ip.description: An IP address assigned to the Kubernetes DNS service. It must be within the Kubernetes Service address range specified in "service cidr"

docker_bridge_cidr.description: A CIDR notation IP range assigned to the Docker bridge network. It must not overlap with any Subnet IP ranges or the Kubernetes Service address range specified in "service cidr"

enable_http_application_routing.description: Enable the Kubernetes ingress with automatic public DNS name creation

enable_monitoring.description: Turn on Azure Log Analytics monitoring. Uses the Log Analytics "Default" workspace if it exists, else creates one. if using an existing workspace, specifies "log analytics workspace resource id"

log_analytics_workspace.description: The name of an existing Azure Log Analytics Workspace to use for storing monitoring data. If not specified, uses '{resource group}-{subscription id}-{location code}'

log_analytics_workspace_resource_group.description: The resource group of an existing Azure Log Analytics Workspace to use for storing monitoring data. If not specified, uses the 'Cluster' resource group

master_dns_prefix.description: DNS prefix to use the Kubernetes cluster control pane

max_pods.description: Maximum number of pods that can run on a node

network_plugin.description: Network plugin used for building Kubernetes network. Chooses from [azure kubenet]

network_policy.description: Network policy used for building Kubernetes network. Chooses from [calico]

pod_cidr.description: A CIDR notation IP range from which to assign Kubernetes Pod IPs when "network plugin" is specified in "kubenet".

resource_group.description: The name of the Cluster resource group

service_cidr.description: A CIDR notation IP range from which to assign Kubernetes Service cluster IPs. It must not overlap with any Subnet IP ranges

ssh_public_key_contents.description: Contents of the SSH public key used to authenticate with Linux hosts

subnet.description: The name of an existing Azure Virtual Subnet. Composite of agent virtual network subnet ID

subscription_id.description: Subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription

tag.description: Tags for Kubernetes cluster. For example, foo=bar

virtual_network.description: The name of an existing Azure Virtual Network. Composite of agent virtual network subnet ID

virtual_network_resource_group.description: The resource group of an existing Azure Virtual Network. Composite of agent virtual network subnet ID

access_key.description: The AWS Client ID to use

ami.description: A custom AMI ID to use for the worker nodes instead of the default

associate_worker_node_public_ip.description: Associate public ip EKS worker nodes

desired_nodes.description: The desired number of worker nodes

instance_type.description: The type of machine to use for worker nodes

key_pair_name.description: Allow user to specify key name to use

maximum_nodes.description: The maximum number of worker nodes

minimum_nodes.description: The minimum number of worker nodes

node_volume_size.description: The volume size for each node

region.description: The AWS Region to create the EKS cluster in

secret_key.description: The AWS Client Secret associated with the Client ID

security_groups.description: List of security groups to use for the cluster

service_role.description: The service role to use to perform the cluster operations in AWS

session_token.description: A session token to use with the client key and secret if applicable

subnets.description: List of subnets in the virtual network to use

user_data.description: Pass user-data to the nodes to perform automated configuration tasks

virtual_network.description: The name of the virtual network to use

cluster_ipv4_cidr.description: The IP address range of the container pods

credential.description: The contents of the GC credential file

description.description: An optional description of this cluster

disk_size_gb.description: Size of the disk attached to each node

disk_type.description: Type of the disk attached to each node

enable_auto_repair.description: Specifies whether the node auto-repair is enabled for the node pool

enable_auto_upgrade.description: Specifies whether node auto-upgrade is enabled for the node pool

enable_horizontal_pod_autoscaling.description: Enable horizontal pod autoscaling for the cluster

enable_http_load_balancing.description: Enable http load balancing for the cluster

enable_kubernetes_dashboard.description: Whether to enable the kubernetes dashboard

enable_legacy_abac.description: Whether to enable legacy abac on the cluster

enable_master_authorized_network.description: Whether or not master authorized network is enabled

enable_network_policy_config.description: Enable network policy config for the cluster

enable_private_endpoint.description: Whether the master's internal IP address is used as the cluster endpoint

enable_private_nodes.description: Whether nodes have internal IP address only

image_type.description: The image to use for the worker nodes

ip_policy_cluster_ipv4_cidr_block.description: The IP address range for the cluster pod IPs

ip_policy_cluster_secondary_range_name.description: The name of the secondary range to be used for the cluster CIDR block

ip_policy_create_subnetwork.description: Whether a new subnetwork will be created automatically for the cluster

ip_policy_node_ipv4_cidr_block.description: The IP address range of the instance IPs in this cluster

ip_policy_services_ipv4_cidr_block.description: The IP address range of the services IPs in this cluster

ip_policy_services_secondary_range_name.description: The name of the secondary range to be used for the services CIDR block

ip_policy_subnetwork_name.description: A custom subnetwork name to be used if createSubnetwork is true

labels.description: The map of Kubernetes labels (key/value pairs) to be applied to each node

local_ssd_count.description: The number of local SSD disks to be attached to the node

locations.description: Locations to use for the cluster

machine_type.description: The machine type to use for the worker nodes

maintenance_window.description: When to performance updates on the nodes, in 24-hour time

master_authorized_network_cidr_blocks.description: Define up to 10 external networks that could access Kubernetes master through HTTPS

master_ipv4_cidr_block.description: The IP range in CIDR notation to use for the hosted master network

max_node_count.description: Maximum number of nodes in the NodePool. Must be >= minNodeCount. There has to enough quota to scale up the cluster

min_node_count.description: Minimmum number of nodes in the NodePool. Must be >= 1 and <= maxNodeCount

network.description: The network to use for the cluster

node_count.description: The number of nodes to create in this cluster

node_pool.description: The ID of the cluster node pool

node_version.description: The version of kubernetes to use on the nodes

oauth_scopes.description: The set of Google API scopes to be made available on all of the node VMs under the default service account

preemptible.description: Whether the nodes are created as preemptible VM instances

project_id.description: The ID of your project to use when creating a cluster

region.description: The region to launch the cluster. Region or zone should be used

resource_labels.description: The map of Kubernetes labels (key/value pairs) to be applied to each cluster

service_account.description: The Google Cloud Platform Service Account to be used by the node VMs

sub_network.description: The sub-network to use for the cluster

taints.description: List of kubernetes taints to be applied to each node

use_ip_aliases.description: Whether alias IPs will be used for pod IPs in the cluster

zone.description: The zone to launch the cluster. Zone or region should be used

addon_job_timeout.description: Optional duration in seconds of addon job.

addons.description: Optional addons descripton to deploy on rke cluster.

addons_include.description: Optional addons yaml manisfest to deploy on rke cluster.

ignore_docker_version.description: Optional ignore docker version on nodes

prefix_path.description: Optional prefix to customize kubernetes path

ssh_cert_path.description: Optional cluster level SSH certificate path

ssh_key_path.description: Optional cluster level SSH private key path

load_balancer_sku.description: Load balancer type (basic | standard). Must be standard for auto-scaling

block.description: Optional private registries for docker images

state_confirm.description: Wait until active status is confirmed a number of times (wait interval of 5s)

wait_monitoring.description: Wait until monitoring is up and running

access_type.description: Member access type: member, owner, read-only

default_cluster_role_for_project_members.description: Default cluster role for project members

default_pod_security_policy_template_id.description: Default pod security policy template ID

addon_job_timeout.description: Optional duration in seconds of addon job.

addons.description: Optional addons descripton to deploy on rke cluster.

addons_include.description: Optional addons yaml manisfest to deploy on rke cluster.

ignore_docker_version.description: Optional ignore docker version on nodes

prefix_path.description: Optional prefix to customize kubernetes path

ssh_cert_path.description: Optional cluster level SSH certificate path

ssh_key_path.description: Optional cluster level SSH private key path

load_balancer_sku.description: Load balancer type (basic | standard). Must be standard for auto-scaling

block.description: Optional private registries for docker images

revision_history_limit.description: Multi cluster app revision history limit

template_version_id.description: Multi cluster app template version ID

wait.description: Wait until multi cluster app is active

access_type.description: Member access type: member, owner, read-only

description.description: Description of the k8s namespace managed by rancher v2

name.description: Name of the k8s namespace managed by rancher v2

project_id.description: Project ID where k8s namespace belongs

block_duration_minutes.description: AWS spot instance duration in minutes (60, 120, 180, 240, 300, or 360)

endpoint.description: Optional endpoint URL (hostname only or fully qualified URI)

kms_key.description: Custom KMS key ID using the AWS Managed CMK

monitoring.description: Set this flag to enable CloudWatch monitoring

open_port.description: Make the specified port number accessible from the Internet

private_address_only.description: Only use a private IP address

request_spot_instance.description: Set this flag to request spot instance

retries.description: Set retry count for recoverable failures (use -1 to disable)

security_group_readonly.description: Skip adding default rules to security groups

spot_price.description: AWS spot instance bid price (in dollar)

ssh_user.description: Set the name of the ssh user

use_private_address.description: Force the usage of private IP address

userdata.description: Path to file with cloud-init user data

availability_set.description: Azure Availability Set to place the virtual machine into

client_id.description: Azure Service Principal Account ID (optional, browser auth is used if not specified)

client_secret.description: Azure Service Principal Account password (optional, browser auth is used if not specified)

disk_size.description: Disk size if using managed disk

dns.description: A unique DNS label for the public IP adddress

fault_domain_count.description: Fault domain count to use for availability set

location.description: Azure region to create the virtual machine

managed_disks.description: Configures VM and availability set for managed disks

no_public_ip.description: Do not create a public IP address for the machine

nsg.description: Azure Network Security Group to assign this node to (accepts either a name or resource ID, default is to create a new NSG for each machine)

open_port.description: Make the specified port number accessible from the Internet

private_ip_address.description: Specify a static private IP address for the machine

resource_group.description: Azure Resource Group name (will be created if missing)

static_public_ip.description: Assign a static public IP address to the machine

storage_type.description: Type of Storage Account to host the OS Disk for the machine

subnet.description: Azure Subnet Name to be used within the Virtual Network

subnet_prefix.description: Private CIDR block to be used for the new subnet, should comply RFC 1918

update_domain_count.description: Update domain count to use for availability set

use_private_ip.description: Use private IP address of the machine to connect

vnet.description: Azure Virtual Network name to connect the virtual machine (in [resourcegroup:]name format)

tags.description: Comma-separated list of tags to apply to the Droplet

userdata.description: Path to file with cloud-init user-data

authorized_users.description: Linode user accounts (seperated by commas) whose Linode SSH keys will be permitted root access to the created node

create_private_ip.description: Create private IP for the instance

image.description: Specifies the Linode Instance image which determines the OS distribution and base files

instance_type.description: Specifies the Linode Instance type which determines CPU, memory, disk size, etc.

region.description: Specifies the region (location) of the Linode instance

ssh_user.description: Specifies the user as which docker-machine should log in to the Linode instance to install Docker.

stackscript.description: Specifies the Linode StackScript to use to create the instance

stackscript_data.description: A JSON string specifying data for the selected StackScript

tags.description: A comma separated list of tags to apply to the the Linode resource

ua_prefix.description: Prefix the User-Agent in Linode API calls with some 'product/version'

cfgparam.description: vSphere vm configuration parameters (used for guestinfo)

clone_from.description: If you choose creation type clone a name of what you want to clone is required

cloud_config.description: Filepath to a cloud-config yaml file to put into the ISO user-data

cloudinit.description: vSphere cloud-init filepath or url to add to guestinfo

content_library.description: If you choose to clone from a content library template specify the name of the library

cpu_count.description: vSphere CPU number for docker VM

creation_type.description: Creation type when creating a new virtual machine. Supported values: vm, template, library, legacy

custom_attributes.description: vSphere custom attributes, format key/value e.g. '200=my custom value'

datastore_cluster.description: vSphere datastore cluster for virtual machine

disk_size.description: vSphere size of disk for docker VM (in MB)

folder.description: vSphere folder for the docker VM. This folder must already exist in the datacenter

hostsystem.description: vSphere compute resource where the docker VM will be instantiated. This can be omitted if using a cluster with DRS

memory_size.description: vSphere size of memory for docker VM (in MB)

network.description: vSphere network where the virtual machine will be attached

pool.description: vSphere resource pool for docker VM

ssh_password.description: If using a non-B2D image you can specify the ssh password

ssh_port.description: If using a non-B2D image you can specify the ssh port

ssh_user.description: If using a non-B2D image you can specify the ssh user

ssh_user_group.description: If using a non-B2D image the uploaded keys will need chown'ed, defaults to staff e.g. docker:staff

vapp_ip_allocation_policy.description: vSphere vApp IP allocation policy. Supported values are: dhcp, fixed, transient and fixedAllocated

vapp_ip_protocol.description: vSphere vApp IP protocol for this deployment. Supported values are: IPv4 and IPv6

vapp_transport.description: vSphere OVF environment transports to use for properties. Supported values are: iso and com.vmware.guestInfo

allow_privilege_escalation.description: allowPrivilegeEscalation determines if a pod can request to allow privilege escalation. If unspecified, defaults to true.

allowed_capabilities.description: allowedCapabilities is a list of capabilities that can be requested to add to the container. Capabilities in this field may be added at the pod author's discretion. You must not list a capability in both allowedCapabilities and requiredDropCapabilities.

allowed_proc_mount_types.description: AllowedProcMountTypes is a whitelist of allowed ProcMountTypes. Empty or nil indicates that only the DefaultProcMountType may be used. This requires the ProcMountType feature flag to be enabled.

allowed_unsafe_sysctls.description: allowedUnsafeSysctls is a list of explicitly allowed unsafe sysctls, defaults to none. Each entry is either a plain sysctl name or ends in "*" in which case it is considered as a prefix of allowed sysctls. Single * means all unsafe sysctls are allowed. Kubelet has to whitelist all allowed unsafe sysctls explicitly to avoid rejection.

default_add_capabilities.description: defaultAddCapabilities is the default set of capabilities that will be added to the container unless the pod spec specifically drops the capability.  You may not list a capability in both defaultAddCapabilities and requiredDropCapabilities. Capabilities added here are implicitly allowed, and need not be included in the allowedCapabilities list.

default_allow_privilege_escalation.description: defaultAllowPrivilegeEscalation controls the default setting for whether a process can gain more privileges than its parent process.

description.description: Pod Security Policy template policy description

forbidden_sysctls.description: forbiddenSysctls is a list of explicitly forbidden sysctls, defaults to none. Each entry is either a plain sysctl name or ends in "*" in which case it is considered as a prefix of forbidden sysctls. Single * means all sysctls are forbidden.

host_ipc.description: hostIPC determines if the policy allows the use of HostIPC in the pod spec.

host_network.description: hostNetwork determines if the policy allows the use of HostNetwork in the pod spec.

host_pid.description: hostPID determines if the policy allows the use of HostPID in the pod spec.

name.description: Pod Security Policy template policy name

privileged.description: privileged determines if a pod can request to be run as privileged.

read_only_root_filesystem.description: readOnlyRootFilesystem when set to true will force containers to run with a read only root file system.  If the container specifically requests to run with a non-read only root file system the PSP should deny the pod. If set to false the container may run with a read only root file system if it wishes but it will not be forced to.

required_drop_capabilities.description: requiredDropCapabilities are the capabilities that will be dropped from the container.  These are required to be dropped and cannot be added.

volumes.description: volumes is a white list of allowed volume plugins. Empty indicates that no volumes may be used. To allow all volumes you may use '*'

name.description: Name is the registered name of the CSI driver

block.description: AllowedCSIDrivers is a whitelist of inline CSI drivers that must be explicitly set to be embedded within a pod spec. An empty value indicates that any CSI driver can be used for inline ephemeral volumes. This is an alpha field, and is only honored if the API server enables the CSIInlineVolume feature gate.

driver.description: driver is the name of the Flexvolume driver.

block.description: allowedFlexVolumes is a whitelist of allowed Flexvolumes.  Empty or nil indicates that all Flexvolumes may be used.  This parameter is effective only when the usage of the Flexvolumes is allowed in the "volumes" field.

path_prefix.description: pathPrefix is the path prefix that the host volume must match. It does not support `*`. Trailing slashes are trimmed when validating the path prefix with a host path.

read_only.description: when set to true, will allow host volumes matching the pathPrefix only if all volume mounts are readOnly.

block.description: allowedHostPaths is a white list of allowed host paths. Empty indicates that all host paths may be used.

rule.description: rule is the strategy that will dictate what FSGroup is used in the SecurityContext.

max.description: max is the end of the range, inclusive.

min.description: min is the start of the range, inclusive.

block.description: ranges are the allowed ranges of fs groups.  If you would like to force a single fs group then supply a single range with the same start and end. Required for MustRunAs.
fsGroup is the strategy that will dictate what fs group is used by the SecurityContext.

max.description: max is the end of the range, inclusive.

min.description: min is the start of the range, inclusive.

block.description: hostPorts determines which host port ranges are allowed to be exposed.

rule.description: rule is the strategy that will dictate the allowable RunAsGroup values that may be set.

max.description: max is the end of the range, inclusive.

min.description: min is the start of the range, inclusive.

block.description: ranges are the allowed ranges of gids that may be used. If you would like to force a single gid then supply a single range with the same start and end. Required for MustRunAs.

RunAsGroup is the strategy that will dictate the allowable RunAsGroup values that may be set. If this field is omitted, the pod's RunAsGroup can take any value. This field requires the RunAsGroup feature gate to be enabled.

rule.description: rule is the strategy that will dictate the allowable RunAsUser values that may be set.

max.description: max is the end of the range, inclusive.

min.description: min is the start of the range, inclusive.

block.description: ranges are the allowed ranges of uids that may be used. If you would like to force a single uid then supply a single range with the same start and end. Required for MustRunAs.
runAsUser is the strategy that will dictate the allowable RunAsUser values that may be set.

allowed_runtime_class_names.description: allowedRuntimeClassNames is a whitelist of RuntimeClass names that may be specified on a pod. A value of "*" means that any RuntimeClass name is allowed, and must be the only item in the list. An empty list requires the RuntimeClassName field to be unset.

default_runtime_class_name.description: defaultRuntimeClassName is the default RuntimeClassName to set on the pod. The default MUST be allowed by the allowedRuntimeClassNames list. A value of nil does not mutate the Pod.

block.description: runtimeClass is the strategy that will dictate the allowable RuntimeClasses for a pod. If this field is omitted, the pod's runtimeClassName field is unrestricted. Enforcement of this field depends on the RuntimeClass feature gate being enabled.

rule.description: rule is the strategy that will dictate the allowable labels that may be set.

level.description: Level is SELinux level label that applies to the container.

role.description: Role is a SELinux role label that applies to the container.

type.description: Type is a SELinux type label that applies to the container.

user.description: User is a SELinux user label that applies to the container.

block.description: seLinuxOptions required to run as; required for MustRunAs. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/configure-pod-container/security-context/
seLinux is the strategy that will dictate the allowable labels that may be set.

rule.description: rule is the strategy that will dictate what supplemental groups is used in the SecurityContext.

max.description: max is the end of the range, inclusive.

min.description: min is the start of the range, inclusive.

block.description: ranges are the allowed ranges of supplemental groups.  If you would like to force a single supplemental group then supply a single range with the same start and end. Required for MustRunAs.
supplementalGroups is the strategy that will dictate what supplemental groups are used by the SecurityContext.

namespace_id.description: Namespace ID to add docker registry

project_id.description: Project ID to add docker registry

default_role.description: Default role template for new created cluster or project

ttl.description: Token time to live in seconds

values_yaml.description: values.yaml file content of the app

default_pod_security_policy_template_id.description: Default pod security policy template id

revision_history_limit.description: Multi cluster app revision history limit

template_version_id.description: Multi cluster app template version ID

annotations.description: Annotations of the k8s namespace managed by rancher v2

description.description: Description of the k8s namespace managed by rancher v2

labels.description: Labels of the k8s namespace managed by rancher v2

name.description: Name of the k8s namespace managed by rancher v2

project_id.description: Project ID where k8s namespace belongs

min.description: min is the start of the range, inclusive.

block.description: ranges are the allowed ranges of gids that may be used. If you would like to force a single gid then supply a single range with the same start and end. Required for MustRunAs.

RunAsGroup is the strategy that will dictate the allowable RunAsGroup values that may be set. If this field is omitted, the pod's RunAsGroup can take any value. This field requires the RunAsGroup feature gate to be enabled.

block.description: ranges are the allowed ranges of uids that may be used. If you would like to force a single uid then supply a single range with the same start and end. Required for MustRunAs.
runAsUser is the strategy that will dictate the allowable RunAsUser values that may be set.

allowed_runtime_class_names.description: allowedRuntimeClassNames is a whitelist of RuntimeClass names that may be specified on a pod. A value of "*" means that any RuntimeClass name is allowed, and must be the only item in the list. An empty list requires the RuntimeClassName field to be unset.

default_runtime_class_name.description: defaultRuntimeClassName is the default RuntimeClassName to set on the pod. The default MUST be allowed by the allowedRuntimeClassNames list. A value of nil does not mutate the Pod.

block.description: runtimeClass is the strategy that will dictate the allowable RuntimeClasses for a pod. If this field is omitted, the pod's runtimeClassName field is unrestricted. Enforcement of this field depends on the RuntimeClass feature gate being enabled.

rule.description: rule is the strategy that will dictate the allowable labels that may be set.

level.description: Level is SELinux level label that applies to the container.

role.description: Role is a SELinux role label that applies to the container.

type.description: Type is a SELinux type label that applies to the container.

user.description: User is a SELinux user label that applies to the container.

block.description: seLinuxOptions required to run as; required for MustRunAs. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/configure-pod-container/security-context/
seLinux is the strategy that will dictate the allowable labels that may be set.

rule.description: rule is the strategy that will dictate what supplemental groups is used in the SecurityContext.

max.description: max is the end of the range, inclusive.

min.description: min is the start of the range, inclusive.

block.description: ranges are the allowed ranges of supplemental groups.  If you would like to force a single supplemental group then supply a single range with the same start and end. Required for MustRunAs.
supplementalGroups is the strategy that will dictate what supplemental groups are used by the SecurityContext.

cluster_id.description: ID of the cluster to whom the project belongs

namespace_id.description: Namespace ID to add docker registry

project_id.description: Project ID to add docker registry

default_role.description: Default role template for new created cluster or project
